text: so my name is Anna and for the last 12
years I struggled with the symptoms that
come alongside PCOS otherwise known as
polycystic ovary syndrome when I was
first diagnosed with PCOS at the age of
12 I was struggling with my way and
words like infertility and type 2
diabetes were being thrown around me at
doctor's appointments and I was
terrified no idea what was going on for
those of you not in the know lucky you
polycystic ovary syndrome is a very
common condition at which according to
the NHS affects one in five women
basically it's caused by an abnormal
level of hormones and your body
specifically estrogen testosterone and
insulin there are a couple of widely
known symptoms that come alongside PCOS
but there are several that nobody talks
about and that I am still learning about
the most common side effect PCOS is
irregular periods which can often lead
to difficulties when it comes to
conceiving other symptoms include
excessive hair growth weight gain and
darkening of skin these are just some of
the symptoms which affect women with
PCOS
some people might speeds and Fertel as
he but be underweight and how the
smoothness of phases other symptoms of
which many women experience include
anxiety and depression mood swings joint
pains here thinning and insulin
resistance going up I had some of these
symptoms but in recent years I've
learned that the ones that aren't
readily discussed all the time are the
ones that affected and continue to
affect me when I was first diagnosed
with PCOS it was a very confusing time I
was becoming a teenager which in itself
is a very confusing time but a teenager
with PCOS I was making silly life
choices I was going for fad diets and
that as a habit that I'm still trying to
break however symptoms like my mental
health was something that I was never
told about throughout my late teens and
my 20s I felt like I was going crazy
I was experiencing some of the highest
highs and the lowest lows and it wasn't
until I realized that other women who
have PCOS were also going through the
same emotions I awaked
and my mental health are something that
often go hand in hand and my fluctuating
weight gain has been incredibly
exhausting to work through from my own
personal experience and from what I was
told when I was younger and as I could
control my weight which was a direct
result of having PCOS the seven times
all of my PCOS would significantly
decrease which would then improve my
fertility so suddenly it became ironic
that the weight that I held became the
weight on my shoulders people often
thought that my PCOS was an excuse for
me being overweight and it still bothers
me when I get comments about it because
I don't know how to tell someone that
their diet
or their workout plan may not
necessarily affect me in the same way it
affects them life with PCOS is a
struggle both on the inside and the
outside PCOS is a but I'm
determined to make it our
